alert.note: Alert for Ohio (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 25 at 5:10AM EDT until March 25 at 8:28PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Louisville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Kentucky... Rough River near Dundee affecting Ohio County. .Heavy rain from the past 24 hours will cause the river to rise. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Rough River near Dundee. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, County roads between Dundee and Narrows flood. At 26.0 feet, County roads near Sunnydale flood. At 27.0 feet, KY 919 flood at Underwood and Clifty Huff Roads near Narrows. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 23.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 26.4 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Action stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding is possible and rivers are forecast to exceed bankfull. If you are in the advisory area remain alert to possible flooding, or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued later this morning.
